intro: [WRONG START] Mikania aquatica, commonly known as water vine or water hemp, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems that can reach lengths of several meters. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds. Mikania aquatica is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, where it thrives in moist, sunny conditions.
